comment: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.
commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
commenthtml: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.
inlinecomment: &apos; Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. Used as the abstract class for JsonGetterConverter and JsonSetterConverter.

methods.label: deserialize
methods.signature: Sub deserialize(holder As JsonConversionHolder, source As JsonObject)

methods.label: serialize
methods.signature: Sub serialize(source As Variant, target As JsonObject)

arguments.label: source
arguments.comment: VoltScript object from which to serialize
arguments.commenthtml: VoltScript object from which to serialize
arguments.inlinecomment: &apos; VoltScript object from which to serialize

methods.label: withCustomConverter
methods.comment: Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Run a class&apos;s setName(firstName, lastName) function, but convert last name to upper case before passing it in.
%END REM
Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter
Dim upperCaseConverter as New ConvertToUCaseConverter()
Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)
Call converter.withCustomConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;, upperCaseConverter)
methods.signature: Function withCustomConverter(labelName As String, converter As AbstractJsonConverter) As Variant
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Passes a custom converter to this AbstractJsonFunctionConverter. The converter will be used to convert the relevant label to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Run a class&apos;s setName(firstName, lastName) function, but convert last name to upper case before passing it in.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter&lt;br /&gt;Dim upperCaseConverter as New ConvertToUCaseConverter()&lt;br /&gt;Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call converter.withCustomConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;, upperCaseConverter)

arguments.label: converter
arguments.comment: AbstractJsonConverter to use when deserializing the value
arguments.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;AbstractJsonConverter to use when deserializing the value&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
arguments.commenthtml: AbstractJsonConverter to use when deserializing the value
arguments.inlinecomment: &apos; AbstractJsonConverter to use when deserializing the value

methods.label: withLiteralParam
methods.comment: Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter
methods.codesample:
%REM
Ensures that when extracting the gender element from a JSON object, the target class&apos;s setGender method is called with the literal value &quot;M&quot;. 
This is found in the CustomSetterTest sample, a hard-coded test for validation purposes only.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim genderConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()
Call genderConverter.forSetter(setGender).withLiteralParam(&quot;M&quot;)
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;gender&quot;, genderConverter)
methods.signature: Function withLiteralParam(paramVal As Variant) As AbstractJsonFunctionConverter
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Fluent method to pass a literal value as a parameter for the converter
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Ensures that when extracting the gender element from a JSON object, the target class&apos;s setGender method is called with the literal value &quot;M&quot;. &lt;br /&gt;This is found in the CustomSetterTest sample, a hard-coded test for validation purposes only.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim genderConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()&lt;br /&gt;Call genderConverter.forSetter(setGender).withLiteralParam(&quot;M&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;gender&quot;, genderConverter)
